CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 20, 1958, pg. 11, reads: "Grand Opening at Renee's - Shown are members of the faculty of Renee's Dance Studio at their grand opening last Sunday in beautiful Terrace Room of the Terrace Hall Hotel, 2337 Centre Ave... Guests at the grand opening were treated to food and refreshment, plus a floor show, featuring Lois (Shorts) Davis, Rudolph Moses, Sara Burney and others.  The management received a bevy of greeting via telegrams and flowers.  For information, call ATlantic 1-1171 or MAyflower 1-8870. - Harris Photo. - Adv."Image published in obituary in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 13, 1961, p. 27, with text reading: "Young, Mrs. Florence J., 617 Latimer St., died May 6.  A member of Victory Chapter 97, OEM, services were held at Central Baptist Church on May 10, with Rev. Cornell E. Talley officiating.  Interment was in [illegible] Cemetery with Jones Funeral Home in charge.  Survivors are the widower, Frank Young, U. S. Army, son Franklin Lee Smith; mother, Edmonia Stevens; three sisters, Mrs. Sara Harley, Washington, Pa.; Mrs. Mollie Arter, Pittsburgh, and Mrs. Martha Edwards, Los Angeles, Calif."Image published in memoriam in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 5, 1962, pg. 18, with text reading: "Memorial to Florence Young who passed away one year ago, May 6, 1961. Memorial to a loved one. She is not away, just out of sight, her presence fills us day and night, her spirit guides us like a star, to God, and where the eternals are.  By Herbert Johnson, Cousin.  Sadly missed by: Edmonia Stevens, mother; Francis Lee Smith, son; Sarah Harley, sister; Molly Arter, sister; Martha Edwards, sister, nephews, nieces, aunts and uncles."
TitMainTitle: "Happy" Mahon, Renee Young [Florence Wright] wearing sequinned dress, and unknown woman, standing behind sheet cake in Terrace Room of Terrace Hall Hotel at 2337 Centre Avenue, for opening of Renee's Dance Studio
